fields.summary: Extra profile picture appearing in the email notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49492].
  {panel}

We are experiencing My Calendars loading performance degradation over time, I assume it relates to growth of the amount of events in our calendars. Now we have reached the point where My Calendar loading takes more than 15 seconds in Team Calendars is actually gets unusable.

I searched the bug tracker for similar issues and I see that such problem is well know by developers but so far there is only promise that it will be fixed in next major version(for example, TEAMCAL-1911, TEAMCAL-485).

It is completely unacceptable - the product which we have bought is UNUSABLE, so this issue has to be treated with the highest priority!
I understand that the fix can not be trivial, so it makes sense to plan it for next major version, but in such case you have to provide us with some workaround - for example, DB tuning scripts, scripts to remove the old events etc.
fields.summary: Confluence Team Calendars slow loading

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49490].
  {panel}

I'm having problems adding Jira related Events to Team Calendars.
When I select "Add Event" and choose any of the Jira Event types, the additional options never load (like Project List) and there is a timeout after about 2 minutes. 

What's interesting is that when I Disable the ical 1.1 plugin in Jira and go back to Team Calendars, I'm able to proceed with adding a Jira event, the additional options load and I'm able to add the Event. But as soon as I add, there's a timeout right above the calendar itself and the Issue Dates never load. So I go back to Jira and enable ical 1.1 again. After that, Issue Dates are displayed on the Calendar properly.

h4.Steps to Reproduce: 

# Install Team Calendars 4.0.3.1 in Confluence
# Install Jira iCalendar plugin version 1.1 (latest one)
# Create a new Calendar in Team Calendars
# After created, click on "Add Event" option in the Calendar name (the arrow in the right side of the screen)
# Try to pick an JIRA even (Jira Project Releases, in example)
# You will receive a timeout error displayed in red in the "Create Even" screen not allowing you to proceed.
fields.summary: Team Calendar 4.0.3.1 and Jira JIRA iCalendar Plugin 1.1 times out

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49487].
  {panel}

h4.Steps to Reproduce:
# Download the ICS file attached
# Import the ICS into Google Calendar
# From calendar settings take the private URL of the calendar (iCal). 
# Subscribe to the Calendar in Team Calendar from {{Add Calendar > Subscribe by URL}}. 

 
h4.Actual Results:
- Events will not be displayed in TC

In the logs:
{code}
2014-02-06 06:32:46,281 WARN [http-8090-2] [extra.calendar3.util.CalendarImportUtil] SanitizeEventTimeZone Unknown timezone: Etc/GMT-9 for event SUMMARY:TV14
. Event timezone set to: Australia/Sydney
 -- referer: http://localhost:8090/index.action | url: /rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/subcalendars.json | userName: admin
{code}
Note that event summary here is: TV14

{code}
2014-02-06 06:33:35,555 ERROR [http-8090-2] [extra.calendar3.rest.CalendarResource] doInTransaction Unable to load events of sub-calendar 3f413ca4-3ceb-4152-b9b7-f5d27430c0a6
 -- referer: http://localhost:8090/ | url: /rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/events.json | userName: admin
java.lang.NullPointerException
  at edu.emory.mathcs.backport.java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap.get(ConcurrentHashMap.java:769)
  at net.fortuna.ical4j.model.TimeZoneRegistryImpl.getTimeZone(TimeZoneRegistryImpl.java:137)
  at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.DefaultJodaIcal4jTimeZoneMapper.getIcal4jTimeZone(DefaultJodaIcal4jTimeZoneMapper.java:116)
  at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.DefaultCalendarManager.getSubCalendarTimeZone(DefaultCalendarManager.java:423)
  at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.DefaultCalendarManager.getEvents(DefaultCalendarManager.java:574)
  at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.rest.CalendarResource$9.doInTransaction(CalendarResource.java:685)
  at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.rest.CalendarResource$9.doInTransaction(CalendarResource.java:651)
  at com.atlassian.sal.core.transaction.HostContextTransactionTemplate$1.doInTransaction(HostContextTransactionTemplate.java:25)
  at com.atlassian.sal.spring.component.SpringHostContextAccessor$1.doInTransaction(SpringHostContextAccessor.java:88)
  at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate.execute(TransactionTemplate.java:128)
  at com.atlassian.sal.spring.component.SpringHostContextAccessor.doInTransaction(SpringHostContextAccessor.java:82)
  at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor92.invoke(Unknown Source)
{code}

{code}
2014-02-06 06:33:35,569 ERROR [http-8090-2] [jersey.spi.container.ContainerResponse] logException Mapped exception to response: 500 (Internal Server Error)
 -- referer: http://localhost:8090/ | url: /rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/events.json | userName: admin
javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException
  at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.rest.CalendarResource$9.doInTransaction(CalendarResource.java:729)
  at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.rest.CalendarResource$9.doInTransaction(CalendarResource.java:651)
  at com.atlassian.sal.core.transaction.HostContextTransactionTemplate$1.doInTransaction(HostContextTransactionTemplate.java:25)
  at com.atlassian.sal.spring.component.SpringHostContextAccessor$1.doInTransaction(SpringHostContextAccessor.java:88)
  at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate.execute(TransactionTemplate.java:128)
  at com.atlassian.sal.spring.component.SpringHostContextAccessor.doInTransaction(SpringHostContextAccessor.java:82)
  at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor92.invoke(Unknown Source)
  at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
  at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
{code}

h4.Workaround:

In google Calendar, locate the event that is throwing this error (In this example the event is TV14), and do the following:
- Click on it and press "Edit Event".
- Click on Time-zone to set the time-zone to a time-zone in Google Calendar and save.
- From calendar settings take the private URL of the calendar (iCal) and try to subscribe again.
fields.summary: Subscribing by URL to a calendar fails when the calendar has complex recurrence rules on events and unrecognized timezone

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49482].
  {panel}

Preconditions
* create a user that called "test"
* login with admin on browser 1
* login with test on browser 2

Steps
* Admin: create a calendar and an event on it.
* Test: subscribe this calendar
* Admin: create a Travel event
* Test: refresh subscribed calendar
* => There are 2 Travel events (same name) on Test's calendar

* Admin: create a Leave event
* Test: refresh subscribed calendar
* => There are 4 Leave events (same name) on Test's calendar

Expected:
* There are only one Travel / Leave on Test's calendar

!Screen Shot 2014-04-23 at 2.19.24 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Leave and Travel are duplicated on Subscriber's calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49480].
  {panel}

When adding a JIRA Event Calendar to Confluence, an issue that has the same createdDate and dueDate will not display in the calendar if you show a date range with createdDate and dueDate. The JQL/query that populates the calendar may need to be improved to capture this scenario.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

1. Create a JIRA project and add an issue with a due date in the future. Add another issue with a due date equal to the creation date.
2. Add a JIRA Calendar to a Confluence page, and under *Show* select a date range with start date of _Issue Created Date_ and end date of _Issue Due Date_.
3. When you view the calendar only the issue with a different creation and due date will display.
fields.summary: Team Calendar doesn't show issue if createdDate is same as dueDate

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49476].
  {panel}

From my tests though, 1st load of the Personal Calendar will normally take 4 times the normal amount of time to load the personal calendar. 

h3.Steps to Reproduce
# create a new user in Confluence
# Open up Firebug (the network tab)
# navigate to Team Cal after logging in as the new user
# notice the amount of time it takes to execute GET mycalendar.action 
# then subscribe to some calendars (subscribe to all popular calendars if you need to)
# then try navigating to teamcal again, with firebug still turned on
# see that right now the load time for mycalendar.action is significantly lower (2 - 4 times lower)
fields.summary: First load of Team Calendar takes 2-4 times more time to load

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49450].
  {panel}

I have been having some problems with the subscription to Team Calendars using Outlook. We have created a big calendar system with about 15 different calendars. When we tried to subscribe to some of these calendars using Outlook it has been having trouble linking to the calendar. 

Unfortunately it seems to be different things that are causing the break in different calendars. I have one calendar called "Private Sector Buildings" and this subscription works fine, until I change the color of the calendar (and nothing else) and then it breaks. I have another calendar called "Delta Cities" and this one works fine if you change the color, but breaks if you try to edit the name of the calendar and nothing else. 

I have been trying to add the calendars through the Online Microsoft Portal and through Outlook 2007 and both of them have been having problems. 

I have been testing and have not been able to find why it is causing these problems. I cant find any one correlating thing that is causing this problem, it seems that for different calendars different things are causing this subscription break. 

I wish I had more information on this, but I wanted to pass on that I was having this problem.

Thanks,
Daniel
fields.summary: Problems with Subscription to Team Calendars using Outlook

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49442].
  {panel}

I'm in confluence, click Calendars at the top toolbar.  I edit an event adding "who" for an event.  Upon completion the calendar reloads and doubles everything.  I click Calendars at the top again and it's fine.  I've also seen this issue when editing an event and moving it to a new date.  It shows on old and new dates and doubles on the new date.

h4. Steps to Reproduce in IE
# Navigate to Calendars
# Add a full day event
# Edit the event and change the date

h4. Steps to Reproduce in Chrome
# Navigate to Calendars
# Add a full day event
# Edit the event and add a user (who) for the event 

h4. Actual Result
Upon editing the event, they (Events) will be shown twice. and refreshing the page will fix this.
fields.summary: Editing an event causes calendar to reload and show everything twice
Plugin installation fails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49435].
  {panel}

We are trying to retrieve issues, based on a custom field.  We'd like to create a "JIRA Issue Dates" event type, that retrieves all issues (regardless of project) where a custom field = 'FeatureX'.

To recreate the problem:
  * create a custom issue type
  * create a custom date field on the new issue type (FeatureDate)
  * create a second custom field (FeatureDesc)
  * try to retrieve issues using:
    FeatureDesc='FeatureX'
    We'd like to display the issues on the calendar, based on their   FeatureDate.

Unfortunately, the custom field 'FeatureDate' does not list as one of the options under the 'Single Date' heading.

But if our JQL begins with:
  Project='ProjectA'
then 'FeatureDate' is one of the options under the 'Single Date' heading.

So we can use the following JQL:
  Project='ProjectA' and FeatureDesc='FeatureX'
but not:
  FeatureDesc='FeatureX'
fields.summary: JQL only works when the first parameter entered is 'Project'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49394].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go to _Calendars_ > _Add Event_.
# Set the same or equal start date time and end date time. (For example, 21-AUG-2014 08:00 to 08:00 21-AUG-2014) Error occurs upon pressing _OK_.

Please refer to {{date_time.png}} for occurred error. 

Team Calendars version 4.1.4 and older allows users to enter the same or equal start date time and end date time. Please refer to {{milestone.png}} for the differences. "Brown color" Milestones are created using Team Calendars version 4.1.4 and older. "Blue color" Milestone is created using Team Calendars version 4.2 and later that does not allow an event to have same or equal start date time and end date time.
fields.summary: Allow event to have same or equal start date time and end date time (Milestone)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49391].
  {panel}

Hello,
we use some of our Team Calendars for room reservation. In the monthly display only the start time is displayed. And if a calendar is embedded into a confluence page, you cannot switch to the weekly view.
In order to find free slots it is important to display the end time of an event as well. Currently we have to click on each event in order to see when it will end.

BR Stefan
fields.summary: Display end time in monthly view
New funcionality

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49389].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As of Confluence Team Calendars 5.3.x, [Calendars in space|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/team-calendars-5-3-release-notes-776814122.html#TeamCalendars5.3ReleaseNotes-Calendarsinspace(s)] feature was introduced - which integrates Confluence Team Calendar with Confluence Space.

*Scenario 1*
Due to this, [importing _.ics_ Calendar|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/create-add-and-edit-calendars-654213559.html#Create,Add,andEditCalendars-Addothercalendars] feature then required _Related Space_ field.
This can be a tedious process for user who needs to import a large number of Calendars.

*Scenario 2*
For the upgraded Calendars from a version lower than 5.3.x, the _Related Space_ field will then be empty by default. 
Should the user like to associate their Calendar to a particular Space, they'd then need to do this for each Spaces one by one.

h3. Suggested Solution
To implement bulk update _Related Space_ field on Team Calendars 5.3 and above.
fields.summary: Implementation of Bulk Update Related Space field on Team Calendars 5.3 and above

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49388].
  {panel}

I would like to create a calendar including customer milestones as all day events. The timeline view shall be used.

Problem:
If the zoom is insufficient, only parts of an all day event are visible and it is not possible to read the entire description (see also attached screenshots, popup appears only after selection). 

Solution:
Provide an option for all day events that displays an event like in the current implementation for JIRA issues (pinned to a date by a line / entire title displayed).
fields.summary: Option to view calendar events like JIRA issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49387].
  {panel}

Trying to subscribe to certain Google Calendar via TeamCal results in the following error:
!calendar.jpg!

h3.Resolution
Navigate to {{Confluence Admin >> General Configuration}}, and change both the Connection Timeout and the Socket Timeout to a higher value
fields.summary: Increase the timeout used for Google Calendar Subscription
Export iCal export with specific time frame

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49384].
  {panel}

When selecting a recurring meeting with an End Date, the End Date calendar invokes with the month of the current date. (See attached)

This is a minor inconvenience for the user if the Start Date selected is in a later month, as the user must then advance the calendar month to the desired date. 

Again, this is a very minor concern as the widget works great otherwise. It would just be convenient if the End Date calendar took the Start Date value into consideration and invoked the End Date calendar with the month specified in the Start Date field.

Thanks!
fields.summary: End Date calendar starts with current month rather than Start Date month.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49383].
  {panel}

When searching for a Team Calendar, the results vary significantly depending on how I search.  For my example, we have an Event Calendar for each instance of Jira we are using.  I'm using this method to get to Search Calendar:
From my calendar, Add Calendar, Existing Calendar, Search for Calendar

Available Calendars:
Jira RPD Production
Jira IFS Production
Jira GBS Production
Jira Enterprise Production
Jira CO Production
Jira Bank Production

Here are the search results depending on what the input is:
When I type - 
	Jira = no results
	Jira rpd = no results
	Jira Production = no results
	Jira RPD Production = no results
	"Jira RPD" = Jira RPD Production (same result for all other instances)
	"Jira RPD Production" = Jira RPD Production
	"Jira ifs" = Jira IFS Production shows for half a second, then displays - No results (case sensitive?)  can only replicate if it's first time search.  Once found, it seems to find consistently.
	Production = all 6 results (with or without quotes)

I get the same results in Chrome and Firefox.  Also, the results do not seem to be improved by doing a Calendar Index.
There is a screen shot for these search results.
Sorry for the amount of screenshots, I don't have the ability to do a screen video record.
fields.summary: Team Calendars Search is inconsistent
Couldn't figure out where to add custom events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49380].
  {panel}

*Problem Statement*
To be able to plan events properly for our team we are missing an easy overview in availability.

*Suggestion*
It would help a lot to view/plot the amount of (available) people in a Team.

The attached image is an Excel example to clarify, showing that "Piet" and "Kees" are available.
!Confluence support.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Team Calendar insight in availability

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49379].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Prevent a calendar to be shared anywhere in the instance.

h3. Suggested Solution
# Restrict calendar for being shared on different pages or spaces.
# Associate calendar with a page or group of pages.
fields.summary: Restrict team calendar to a page/space
Allow for Timeline Calendar View to Zoom out further

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Confluence administrator can't check/remove restrictions from calendars

h3. Situation
- You can't see Calendars with restricted viewing.
- When the restriction is exclusive to editing you still can't see who has the permissions to edit.
- There's no way to recover permissions over a calendar.

h3. Notes 

Differently from server admins, Cloud admins can't check/change those restrictions through the database.

h3. Suggested Solution

An administration interface where Confluence administrators can search and edit calendar permissions similar to the *restricted pages* interface in every space but globally for calendars
fields.summary: Provide an administration interface to see and change restricted calendars
Ability to add individual dates created via // (date macro) to calendar
Allow certain fields to be set as mandatory

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49373].
  {panel}

QA team have two calendars that are "Event" and "Leave". Now we want to merge both of them into one to manage more easier.

Workaround
* Edit each event then change their Calendar name one by one.
=> It takes much effort.

Expected
* Team Calendar should provide a function that allows user move all events from this Calendar to that Calendar
fields.summary: Merge two calendars into one
JIRA issue does not show in Confluence Team Calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49368].
  {panel}

An event type what will iterate every time its repeated based on the assigned people to the event.

So if the setup would be something like this..

*Title:* Run updates
*Who:* Peter, John, Tim
*Repeat:* Weekly, once
*From/To:* Monday/Friday

Than it would look something like this:
{code}
week #1: mo - fri, Peter: Run updates
week #2: mo - fri, John: Run updates
week #3: mo - fri, Tim: Run updates
week #4: mo - fri, Peter: Run updates
...
{code}

But it should adjust itself automatically so, if you decide to add a person (Tom) to the bottom spot, after week 4 than it will look like this:
{code}
week #4: mo - fri, Peter: Run updates
week #5: mo - fri, John: Run updates
week #6: mo - fri, Tim: Run updates
week #7: mo - fri, Tom: Run updates
week #8: mo - fri, Peter: Run updates
...
{code}
fields.summary: Iteration event type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49367].
  {panel}

Ability to edit JIRA Project Releases events

h3. Summary

When using Team Calendars for Confluence integrated with JIRA, we are unable to edit the fields *When* and *Description* of JIRA Project Releases events. 

The purpose is to be able to edit its description and stipulate the hours the event will be scheduled. (e.g. 01/01/2015 12:00 - 01/01/2015 18:00).

It's important to notice the options are available if an event is manually entered in the calendar.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a JIRA Project Releases event in JIRA.
# Go to Team Calendars for Confluence and see the event.
# Select *Edit*.
# Try to change the end-date or write down in *Description* field.

h3. Expected Results

# The checkbox _All day event_ may be grayed out.
# Description field does accept writing.
fields.summary: Ability to edit JIRA Project Releases events
Larger display required when clicking on calendar item

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49363].
  {panel}

If you add multiple event types.
eg for a team leave calendar we had, event types such as: annual leave, sick, personal, time in lieu, maternity, etc
however when the calendar is exported to ical for automated processing and reporting the xml shows all these event types as "custom"
you have no idea which one is which
fields.summary: ical export of custom even types should have the event type. now they are all named "custom"
Ability to Change Required Fields for Calendar Event
Filters on calendar views
Allow a team calendar to be updated with a manually uploaded ics file
Handles No Work Context et al exceptions in upgrade tasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49357].
  {panel}

For the time being, the List view only shows the events within the next 30 days. In quite a few cases, we would like to see on one page all the events for one particular type of calendar/filter. For instance, I would to see all the leaves for a specific person as a list in a page.

So a non exhaustive list of options that are useful is:
* Select the max number of items to be shown on the list (with or without limit in time, and could be show all)
* Select a range of dates the list should show
* Select initial and final events between which the events should be listed
* Select a max number of days from today for which the events should be shown in the list (meaning choosing other that the imposed 30 days, could be no date, meaning show all)
fields.summary: More options on list view
Add group to the "Who" section when adding an event

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49354].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
If user create an event in behalf another user he will keep receiving the notification.

h3. Suggested Solution
Be able to select an owner when creating the event.

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Change event owner

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49352].
  {panel}

The display of JIRA issue dates on a calendar is a very useful feature. But it is tantalizing because it comes so close to meeting our requirements and yet is still a few steps away.

We want to display JIRA issues as events, using "due date" or possibly some other JIRA date field, and we can do that now.

But we want to customize the JIRA fields that are visible in the event on the calendar. Currently we can see the issue key and the summary and that is frequently useful. But what we would like is the ability to choose what shows up in the "event cell", i.e., we might like to display the summary and the assignee, or, the summary and the component, etc. It also seems like we should be able to choose what shows in the cell under normal conditions, and, what shows during a hover.

I'm sure you already have this in the queue for a future release.

Thanks for the great product!
fields.summary: Super useful product could easily become exponentially more useful with ability to customize event display

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Chrome & Safari
!Chrome and Safari.png|thumbnail!

Firefox and IE

fields.summary: The last line of edit calendar popup does not show properly on firefox and IE

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49348].
  {panel}

When performing a backup of the space in Confluence, the procedure does not backup the calendars related to the space.

if the user removes the space, the calendar is also removed and the space backup does not restore this data, which is specially dangerous for unadvised users.

h4.Workaround.
We can [backup the calendars separately into ICS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/export-team-calendars-content-to-other-calendars-240913738.html] files and import them manually

h4. Possible Fix
Backup the team calendar information together with the space backup
fields.summary: Space backup does not backup the team calendar information

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49347].
  {panel}

h5.Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence Team Calendars
# Create an event, give it a type of Travel
# Verify the sidebar now contains an item for "Travel" events
# Delete the event you just created - On a fresh install, there would now no longer be any travel events in the calendar

h5.Expected Result:
# "Travel" should be removed, as there are no travel events in the calendar.

h5.Actual Result
# "Travel" is still present even though there are no travel events.
# There is no feedback to suggest that there are no items that match that filter

h5.Impact
It would be nice if the sidebar was consistent with the contents of the calendar. It may also cause confusion if someone goes hunting for a travel event that doesn't exist.
fields.summary: The list of filters for a Calendar should be consistent with the contents of that Calendar
Ability to set multiple date reminders for one event
Reminders only notify the users set in the "Who" field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49344].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There is no way to identify if a calendar was deleted. The only way is to check in the {{"AO_950DC3_TC_SUBCALS"}} table if the calendar still exists.

h3. Suggested Solution
When a calendar is deleted, it should be logged in Confluence logs. It should also include the username that triggered the deletion.
fields.summary: Improve Logging for Team Calendar Actions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49343].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, reminders are very basic and do not include details about the event such as 'Who', 'Where', 'Description', etc. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add more detailed information to reminder email notifications from Team Calendars
fields.summary: As a user, I want Team Calendars Reminders to contain more detailed information about the event
How can I customize colors and design of Team Calendar add-on?
Add a link to user profiles in event popup/tooltip in Team Calendars
Option not to send notification email when editing or creating an event
Jira Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49338].
  {panel}

One use case example:
- Each employee creates their personal calendar with PTO, Travel, etc. and adds a label such as "team-x"
- On "Team X" home page, a team calendar is present which shows all the calendars with the "team-x" label

With this feature, any new employee to the team simply adds the label "team-x" to their calendar and it is automatically added to the overall team page/calendar.

I think this sounds similar to TEAMCAL-700, but I wasn't sure so I wanted to document that particular use case.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Ability to add labels to calendars and then collect a group of calendars based on that label

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49337].
  {panel}

Create event (create event dialog opens)
Select Add new event type from drop down Event type
Create Event type dialog is opened. Add new event type. Close the dialog

Actual: The create event dialog is closed
Expect: After closing create event type dialog it should return to create event dialog to continue create event with that new created event type
fields.summary: Closing create event type dialog should return back to create event dialog if it's triggered from create event dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49325].

h3. Problem Definition
* It would be tedious to manually move each event from a given user to another calendar. 

h3. Suggested Solution
* Ability to move all events from a given user from one calendar to another using JQL 

Team Calendar Version: 5.3.5-D20150916T050833
fields.summary: Ability to move all events from a given user from one calendar to another using JQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49324].

Hello team,
Thanks for the great work.
I have realized that when I define agenda events of a custom even type and assign them to people, these people's names and avatars do not show up in the agenda, if the agenda is set to use the timeline view. All other views render the custom events just all the default event types.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Avatar picture of custom events do not show up in timeline calendars
